alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; Gadsden; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Jackson; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 8:05AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON...GULF... SOUTHEASTERN BAY AND CALHOUN COUNTIES IN THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA... WESTERN GADSDEN...LIBERTY AND WESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES IN BIG BEND FLORIDA THROUGH 900 AM EST/800 AM CST/... At 805 AM EST/705 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Chattahoochee to near Mexico Beach. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Apalachicola, Quincy, Blountstown, Port St. Joe, Mexico Beach, Stonemill Creek, Chattahoochee, Greensboro, Orange, Wewahitchka, Sneads, Gretna, Bristol, Grand Ridge, Altha, Rock Bluff, Honeyville, Clarksville, Vilas, and Chipola Cutoff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EST/800 AM CST/ for the Panhandle of Florida.
